Models¶

class bhp_registration.models.RegisteredSubject(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_subject.classes.base_subject.BaseSubject

RegisteredSubject(created, modified, user_created, user_modified, hostname_created, hostname_modified, id, subject_identifier, first_name, last_name, initials, dob, is_dob_estimated, gender, subject_type, subject_consent_id, registration_identifier, sid, study_site_id, relative_identifier, identity, identity_type, may_store_samples, hiv_status, survival_status, screening_datetime, registration_datetime, randomization_datetime, registration_status, comment, salt)

Parameters:
  • subject_identifier (CharField) – Subject identifier
  • first_name (EncryptedFirstnameField) – (Encryption: rsa local)
  • last_name (EncryptedLastnameField) – (Encryption: rsa restricted)
  • initials (CharField) – Initials
  • dob (DateField) – Format is YYYY-MM-DD
  • is_dob_estimated (IsDateEstimatedField) – If the exact date is not known, please indicate which part of the date is estimated.
  • gender (CharField) – Gender
  • subject_type (CharField) – Subject type
  • subject_consent_id (CharField) – Subject consent id
  • registration_identifier (CharField) – Registration identifier
  • sid (CharField) – Sid
  • study_site_id (ForeignKey) – Site
  • relative_identifier (CharField) – For example, mother’s identifier, if available / appropriate
  • identity (EncryptedIdentityField) – (Encryption: rsa restricted)
  • identity_type (IdentityTypeField) – What type of identity number is this?
  • may_store_samples (CharField) – Does the subject agree to have samples stored after the study has ended
  • hiv_status (CharField) – Hiv status
  • survival_status (CharField) – Survival status
  • screening_datetime (DateTimeField) – Screening datetime
  • registration_datetime (DateTimeField) – Registration datetime
  • randomization_datetime (DateTimeField) – Randomization datetime
  • registration_status (CharField) – Registration status
  • comment (TextField) – Comment
  • salt (SaltField) – Salt
is_dispatched_to_producer()¶

Returns lock status as a boolean needed when using this model with bhp_dispatch.

registration_datetime = None¶

for simplicity, if going straight from screen to rando, update both registration date and randomization date

class bhp_registration.models.BaseRegisteredSubjectModel(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_appointment_helper.models.base_appointment_helper_model.BaseAppointmentHelperModel

Base model for models that need a key to RegisteredSubject.

Such models may be listed by name in the ScheduledGroup model and thus trigger the creation of appointments. Other instances may be Additional forms which are link to a subject but not a time point (for example, a Death model or OffStudy model (see also AdditionalEntryBucket)

Use this along with BaseRegisteredSubjectModelAdmin()

See also

This class inherits methods from edc.subject.appointment_helper that create appointments if the model is configured as a ScheduledGroup model. See base class bhp_appointment_helper.classes.BaseAppointmentHelperModel.

Parameters:registered_subject_id (OneToOneField) – Registered subject
get_subject_identifier()¶

Returns the subject_identifier.

get_visit_model(instance)¶

Returns the visit model which is a subclass of BaseVisitTracking.
